meanings.definition: The state of being idle or lazy.
meanings.sent1: During his idlesse, he lounged on the couch all day.
meanings.sent2: Her idlesse was evident as she procrastinated on her work.
meanings.sent3: The cat's idlesse was quite amusing as it napped in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The idlesse of the stagnant pond mirrored his lack of motivation.
meanings.sent5: The idlesse of winter made the days feel endless and unproductive.

meanings.definition: A lack of activity or productivity.
meanings.sent1: The idlesse in the office was palpable as everyone avoided work.
meanings.sent2: The idlesse of the deserted town was eerie in the afternoon.
meanings.sent3: The idlesse of the clock was comical as it refused to tick.
meanings.sent4: The idlesse of the barren field reflected the drought's impact.
meanings.sent5: The idlesse of the factory signaled a halt in production.

meanings.definition: A period of inactivity or leisure.
meanings.sent1: After a week of hard work, she enjoyed the idlesse of the weekend.
meanings.sent2: The idlesse of the vacation allowed for much-needed relaxation.
meanings.sent3: The idlesse of the park was broken by children playing tag.
meanings.sent4: The idlesse of the library was shattered by the librarian's shout.
meanings.sent5: The idlesse of the beach was disturbed by seagulls squawking overhead.
